intro: Psychotria imerinensis, commonly known as the Madagascar Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, red berries that are typically consumed by birds and other animals. Psychotria imerinensis is often found in moist, shaded forest environments, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
